title: Blessing In Disguise: Kidnappers Take Man In Car, Get Stuck In Delhi Traffic, Caught In 7 Mins!
text:
May be Delhi traffic is not all that bad. Before you get angry at the statement, get this - A gang of carjackers kidnapped someone from Mohan Garden in New Delhi.

The victim was from Shimla and the kidnapping was reported by his brother. Reportedly, the police received a call from the victim’s brother saying that four men in a car kidnapped his brother from Janakpuri and the car had ‘high lander’ written on it. Now, if you have been to West Delhi you would know the traffic there can be really bad.

After receiving the call, Delhi Police swung into action and guess what? They caught up with the kidnappers’ car within seven minutes, as it was stuck in traffic. The car was identified near a red light in Uttam Nagar.

Twitter

The kidnappers realised, that they probably would not be able to escape, courtesy Delhi traffic, three of them left the car and managed to escape through the jam on Najafgarh road. One of the kidnappers, however, was caught by the police, who also managed to rescue the victim.

Reportedly, the arrested kidnapper’s name is Ravi, and he's a resident of Uttam Nagar. The victim has been identified as 21-year-old Rijwal. He told the police that the kidnappers snatched his car keys before taking him to his vehicle parked around an institute in Janakpuri.

The victim’s car was recovered along with Rs 1,650, that kidnappers robbed him of. A case has reportedly been registered under different sections of the Indian Penal Code.

Like I said, may be, Delhi traffic is not all that bad after all.
